name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump cannot just refuse to leave office. “If Trump were inclined to overstay his term, the levers of power work in favor of removal,” Barbara McQuade wrote in February. https://t.co/ZyIB60paJD

name: TheAtlantic
text: Netflix's "Mank" is "a tale of triumph, the kind that’s been told countless times on the silver screen, but never quite with this moving blend of realism and regret," writes @davidlsims. https://t.co/DhQpSQeQKF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Alex Trebek, the iconic host of "Jeopardy," died over the weekend. For more than 8,000 episodes, he embodied a unique combination of seriousness and warmth, @jpinsk writes: https://t.co/z8BlPJIq3w

name: TheAtlantic
text: Don’t be fooled by the old-fashioned presentation of David Fincher's new Netflix film, "Mank." This movie is surprisingly resonant in 2020, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/7jmwVf9CCP

name: TheAtlantic
text: “She sniffed about the threshold for traces of cigarette-smoke ... she even invented an excuse for rummaging his drawers in the search for French novels and cards.” Read “A Granted Prayer,” a newly rediscovered, unpublished story by Edith Wharton: https://t.co/bvKuSJ2Rq0

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Earthlings" strains the bounds of realism to test human society's foundational taboos—not to mention the reader’s stomach. @_stefhayes reads Sayaka Murata's new dystopian novel: https://t.co/KaH435pVpF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Pfizer has shared early results from its coronavirus-vaccine trial, which it says show that the vaccine is more than 90 percent effective.

In October, @sarahzhang outlined the vaccine approval process and warned that early results would not be definitive. https://t.co/mvhEE15gXm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden won the White House, but Republican power in the states isn’t going anywhere, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/Aivf4htjEx

name: TheAtlantic
text: When the exhaustion clears, some liberals will miss Trump, argues @helenlewis. Or rather, they will miss the moral clarity that opposing him brought. When you’re used to fighting enemies, how do you go back to having mere opponents? https://t.co/LDfNa1GFWk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: "For Democrats, this election was an exercise in setting aside differences in support of a broader goal: ending the reign of Donald Trump. Now that this goal has been accomplished, the Democrats’ truce is over." https://t.co/91Qx2PS9rq

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Pandemic school is clearly not working well, especially for younger children,” @ErikaChristakis writes. But parents are coming to understand that school was not always working so great before COVID-19 either. https://t.co/ok8IW7VMDF

name: TheAtlantic
text: If the pandemic didn't persuade everyone to support science in the election, can anything? @jameshamblin writes: https://t.co/ctyO03EmlG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Democrats set aside their differences to elect Joe Biden. Now that he's won, that detente is over, @elainejgodfrey reports. https://t.co/iPHAgGaquL

name: TheAtlantic
text: There’s a reason people say “It’s so good to see your face!” and not “It’s so good to see your elbows!” @MaryLauraPh reflects on the "face hunger" she's developed during the pandemic: https://t.co/ukhzUxS897

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s loss doesn’t mean the inequities facing Black Americans will vanish, but Black athletes have positioned themselves to be a prominent voice in addressing the issues that affect their community," @jemelehill writes: https://t.co/odO83ZWkYW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Republican women in America’s suburbs helped make Joe Biden president, @elainejgodfrey reports. So ... are they Democrats now? https://t.co/rHm2ahLeVP

name: TheAtlantic
text: Related: In October, @elainejgodfrey reported on the anti-Trump women in America’s suburbs (often dismissed as “wine moms” and “MSNBC moms”) who are ushering in a new era of political activism. https://t.co/AIJsCqEKag

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If the Court invalidates the law, the result will be extremely grim: Without the federal funding that supports the law’s coverage expansions, millions of Americans will quickly lose their health insurance," @nicholas_bagley writes: https://t.co/2BNTDya4rt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "California voters looking to the future of their wildly diverse state were correct to conclude that permitting its officials to treat racial groups differently would be dangerous," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/Z636VMFCui

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Two popes knew of sexual misconduct allegations against Theodore McCarrick, a former cardinal, according to a Vatican report released today.

To save the Church, Catholics must take the faith back into their own hands, James Carroll argued in 2019: https://t.co/i9HhKTEcdi
